intro: Psychotria calva var. rupestris, commonly known as the rock psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Guatemala. This plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically white or pale green, with five petals and a prominent spur. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests or rocky outcrops.
